channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2024100228
item.description:
Report E-2024100228

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-30
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 30, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of hydrochloric acid was shipped with a faulty gasket and released approximately one (1) teaspoon of product to the top of the drum. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel wiped down the drum with absorbent wipes until a neutral pH reading was confirmed. The leaking poly drum was placed into one (1) 75-gallon overpack for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2024100183
item.description:
Report E-2024100183

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-08
  • City: JEFFERSON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver overfilled the customer's storage tank. Approximately 60 gallons of diesel fuel was released. Hazchem Environmental responded to the scene and is handling the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2024100356
item.description:
Report X-2024100356

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-25
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWO YUASA NON-SPILLABLE BATTERIES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE NON-SPILLABLE BATTERIES WERE BEING SHIPPED. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
